Embark on a comprehensive journey to comprehend and effectively manage Pure Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (Pure OCD) through Exposure and Response Prevention (ERP) therapy. In this series, we delve into the intricacies of Pure OCD, offering practical insights and step-by-step guidance on how to implement ERP techniques for optimal therapeutic results.

With over 15 years of invaluable experience in Clinical Psychology, Dr. Swati is a licensed Clinical Psychologist registered with the Rehabilitation Council of India (RCI). She has honed her expertise at prestigious institutions, including the National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS, Bengaluru), AIIMS, Delhi, Janakpuri Superspeciality Hospital, RML Hospital, and G B Pant Hospital.
Spend more time in understanding OCD and conquering it with ERP therapy at your own pace.
Resume the course right from where you left off!

ERP therapy is a specialized cognitive-behavioral approach designed to address and manage Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD). It involves systematically exposing individuals to anxiety triggers while simultaneously preventing the accompanying compulsive responses.
ERP operates on the principle of breaking the cycle of obsessions and compulsions. By gradually exposing individuals to their anxiety triggers in a controlled manner and preventing the usual compulsive behaviors, it helps desensitize them to the distressing thoughts, fostering adaptive responses.

The patient is instructed to touch a doorknob without immediately washing their hands. The goal is to gradually expose the patient to the anxiety trigger and discourage the typical compulsive response, fostering a reduction in anxiety over time.

Contamination OCD may result in excessive hand washing, cleaning, and avoiding anything perceived to cause contamination.
Coping and dealing with health worries

Contamination OCD is a subtype of OCD, characterized by obsessions about their fear of becoming contaminated, contaminating others, or spreading germs. Contamination compulsions often involve excessive hand washing, cleaning, and sterilizing behavior.
These fears may have a basis of realistic concern, such as viral or bacterial illness, visible dirt, or toxic materials. But fears of contamination can also stem from

Contamination OCD is a subtype of OCD, characterized by obsessions about their fear of becoming contaminated, contaminating others, or spreading germs. Contamination compulsions often involve excessive hand washing, cleaning, and sterilizing behavior.
These fears may have a basis of realistic concern, such as viral or bacterial illness, visible dirt, or toxic materials. But fears of contamination can also stem from magical thinking, including beliefs that names, mental images, or specific locations can contaminate them.

In this video, we have talked about the Exposure and Response Prevention and how it applies to OCD treatment. The whole premise of ERP is to expose oneself to something that triggers your anxiety and prevent yourself from responding with compulsions. When you do this correctly you allow yourself to achieve habituation and successfully overcome your fears. In this video, we have given a brief description of how to apply ERP with OCD treatment.
You have proved it to yourself that, \u201cJournal writing is a voyage to the interior.\u201d
